Automatic

3 Techniques

  • Univariate Selection using Chi-Square test
  • RFE - Recursive Feature Elimination
  • Tree based feature selection

Univariate Selection

χ2(D,t,c)=∑et∈{0,1}∑ec∈{0,1}(Netec−Eetec)2Eetec\large \chi^2(D,t,c)=\sum_{e_t\in\{0,1\}}\sum_{e_c\in\{0,1\}}\frac{(N_{e_te_c}-E_{e_te_c})^2}{E_{e_te_c}}χ2(D,t,c)=∑et​∈{0,1}​∑ec​∈{0,1}​Eet​ec​​(Net​ec​​−Eet​ec​​)2​

Recursive Feature Elimination

(RFE) works by recursively removing attributes and building a model on those attributes remain.
